repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
C long and C double values can be stored efficiently in a C array and converted from there in a loop.

Large Python `int` values can be stored as a string sequence of character separated base-32 digits since `PyLong_FromString()` can parse the substrings directly.

comment_data.body: It probably isn't worth worrying too much about this. Every version of Python we support is only supposed to be compatible with Visual Studio 2015 and higher.  (I suppose people could be doing odd things trying to use outdated compilers, but it doesn't seem like a big concern)

This makes me wonder if it's worth doing the same as we do for strings (where the constants are stored in a big array on the module state, and just use convenience defines to look up array elements as names).

Happy to be ignored here though if that doesn't simplify things.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2168,31 +2169,134 @@ def generate_codeobject_constants(self):
         self._generate_module_array_traverse_and_clear(Naming.codeobjtab_cname, code_object_count, may_have_refcycles=False)
 
     def generate_num_constants(self):
-        consts = [(c.py_type, c.value[0] == '-', len(c.value), c.value, c.value_code, c)
+        consts = [(c.py_type, len(c.value.lstrip('-')), c.value, c.value_code, c)
                   for c in self.num_const_index.values()]
         consts.sort()
-        init_constants = self.parts['init_constants']
-        for py_type, _, _, value, value_code, c in consts:
+        if not consts:
+            return
+
+        float_constants = []
+        int_constants_by_bytesize = [[]]
+        large_constants = []
+        int_constant_count = 0
+
+        for py_type, _, value, value_code, c in consts:
             cname = c.cname
             self.parts['module_state'].putln("PyObject *%s;" % cname)
             self.parts['module_state_clear'].putln(
                 "Py_CLEAR(clear_module_state->%s);" % cname)
             self.parts['module_state_traverse'].putln(
                 "__Pyx_VISIT_CONST(traverse_module_state->%s);" % cname)
+
             if py_type == 'float':
-                function = 'PyFloat_FromDouble(%s)'
-            elif py_type == 'long':
-                function = 'PyLong_FromString("%s", 0, 0)'
-            elif Utils.long_literal(value):
-                function = 'PyLong_FromString("%s", 0, 0)'
-            elif len(value.lstrip('-')) > 4:
-                function = "PyLong_FromLong(%sL)"
+                float_constants.append((cname, value_code))
             else:
-                function = "PyLong_FromLong(%s)"
-            init_cname = init_constants.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(cname)
-            init_constants.putln('%s = %s; %s' % (
-                init_cname, function % value_code,
-                init_constants.error_goto_if_null(init_cname, self.module_pos)))
+                number_value = Utils.str_to_number(value)
+                bit_length = number_value.bit_length()
+                if bit_length <= 63:
+                    while (bit_length + 8) // 8 > 1 << (len(int_constants_by_bytesize) - 1):
+                        int_constants_by_bytesize.append([])
+                    int_constant_count += 1
+                    int_constants_by_bytesize[-1].append((cname, value_code))
+                else:
+                    large_constants.append((cname, number_value))
+
+        w = self.parts['init_constants']
+
+        def handle_conversion_error():
+            w.putln("if (unlikely(!py_constants[i])) {")
+            w.putln("while (--i >= 0) { Py_DECREF(py_constants[i]); }")
+            w.putln(w.error_goto(self.module_pos))
+            w.putln("}")
+
+        def assign_constants(constants):
+            for i, (cname, value) in enumerate(constants):
+                init_cname = w.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(cname)
+                w.putln(f"{init_cname} = py_constants[{i}];")

comment_data.body: Right. I'll remove that part completely and just use `stdint.h`.

comment_data.body:
Maybe `split_string_literal`?

(I haven't yet managed to reproduce any crash on Windows so this is just a bit of a guess)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2169,31 +2169,136 @@ def generate_codeobject_constants(self):
         self._generate_module_array_traverse_and_clear(Naming.codeobjtab_cname, code_object_count, may_have_refcycles=False)
 
     def generate_num_constants(self):
-        consts = [(c.py_type, c.value[0] == '-', len(c.value), c.value, c.value_code, c)
+        consts = [(c.py_type, len(c.value.lstrip('-')), c.value.lstrip('-'), c.value, c.value_code, c)
                   for c in self.num_const_index.values()]
         consts.sort()
-        init_constants = self.parts['init_constants']
+        if not consts:
+            return
+
+        constant_count = len(consts)
+        self.parts['module_state'].putln(f"PyObject *{Naming.numbertab_cname}[{constant_count}];")
+        # The code objects that we generate only contain plain constants and can never participate in reference cycles.
+        self._generate_module_array_traverse_and_clear(Naming.numbertab_cname, constant_count, may_have_refcycles=False)
+
+        float_constants = []
+        int_constants_by_bytesize = [[]]  # [[1 byte], [2 bytes], [4 bytes], [8 bytes]]
+        large_constants = []
+        int_constant_count = 0
+
         for py_type, _, _, value, value_code, c in consts:
             cname = c.cname
-            self.parts['module_state'].putln("PyObject *%s;" % cname)
-            self.parts['module_state_clear'].putln(
-                "Py_CLEAR(clear_module_state->%s);" % cname)
-            self.parts['module_state_traverse'].putln(
-                "__Pyx_VISIT_CONST(traverse_module_state->%s);" % cname)
             if py_type == 'float':
-                function = 'PyFloat_FromDouble(%s)'
-            elif py_type == 'long':
-                function = 'PyLong_FromString("%s", 0, 0)'
-            elif Utils.long_literal(value):
-                function = 'PyLong_FromString("%s", 0, 0)'
-            elif len(value.lstrip('-')) > 4:
-                function = "PyLong_FromLong(%sL)"
+                float_constants.append((cname, value_code))
             else:
-                function = "PyLong_FromLong(%s)"
-            init_cname = init_constants.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(cname)
-            init_constants.putln('%s = %s; %s' % (
-                init_cname, function % value_code,
-                init_constants.error_goto_if_null(init_cname, self.module_pos)))
+                number_value = Utils.str_to_number(value)
+                bit_length = number_value.bit_length()
+                if bit_length <= 63:
+                    while (bit_length + 8) // 8 > 1 << (len(int_constants_by_bytesize) - 1):
+                        int_constants_by_bytesize.append([])
+                    int_constant_count += 1
+                    int_constants_by_bytesize[-1].append((cname, value_code))
+                else:
+                    large_constants.append((cname, number_value))
+
+        w = self.parts['init_constants']
+        defines = self.parts['constant_name_defines']
+
+        def store_array(name, ctype, constants):
+            values = ','.join([c[1] for c in constants])
+            w.putln(f"{ctype} const {name}[] = {{{values}}};")
+
+        def generate_forloop_start(end):
+            counter_type = 'int' if end < 2**15 else 'Py_ssize_t'
+            w.putln(f"for ({counter_type} i = 0; i < {end}; i++) {{")
+
+        def assign_constant(rhs_code):
+            w.putln(f"numbertab[i] = {rhs_code};")
+            w.putln(w.error_goto_if_null("numbertab[i]", self.module_pos))
+
+        def define_constants(constants, start_offset=0):
+            for i, (cname, _) in enumerate(constants):
+                defines.putln(f"#define {cname} {Naming.numbertab_cname}[{start_offset + i}]")
+
+        constant_offset = 0
+
+        if float_constants:
+            w.putln("{")
+            w.putln(f"PyObject **numbertab = {w.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(Naming.numbertab_cname)};")
+
+            store_array("c_constants", 'double', float_constants)
+            define_constants(float_constants, start_offset=constant_offset)
+
+            generate_forloop_start(len(float_constants))
+            assign_constant("PyFloat_FromDouble(c_constants[i])")
+            w.putln("}")  # for()
+
+            w.putln("}")
+            constant_offset += len(float_constants)
+
+        if int_constant_count > 0:
+            w.putln("{")
+            w.putln(f"PyObject **numbertab = {w.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(Naming.numbertab_cname)} + {constant_offset};")
+
+            int_types = ['', 'int8_t', 'int16_t', 'int32_t', 'int64_t']
+            for byte_size, constants in enumerate(int_constants_by_bytesize, 1):
+                if constants:
+                    store_array(f"cint_constants_{2 ** (byte_size - 1)}", int_types[byte_size], constants)
+                    define_constants(constants, start_offset=constant_offset)
+                    constant_offset += len(constants)
+
+            def read_array_item(constants, byte_size, int_constants_seen):
+                read_item = f"cint_constants_{2 ** (byte_size - 1)}[i - {int_constants_seen}]"
+                if byte_size >= len(constants):
+                    return read_item
+
+                int_constants = constants[byte_size - 1]
+                next_int_constants_seen = int_constants_seen + len(int_constants)
+                read_next_item = read_array_item(constants, byte_size + 1, next_int_constants_seen)
+
+                return (
+                    f"(i < {next_int_constants_seen} ? {read_item} : {read_next_item})"
+                ) if int_constants else read_next_item
+
+            generate_forloop_start(int_constant_count)
+            capi_func = "PyLong_FromLong" if len(int_constants_by_bytesize) <= 3 else "PyLong_FromLongLong"
+            assign_constant(f"{capi_func}({read_array_item(int_constants_by_bytesize, 1, 0)})")
+            w.putln("}")  # for()
+
+            w.putln("}")
+
+        if large_constants:
+            # We store large integer constants in a single '\0'-separated C string of base32 digits.
+            base32_digits = '0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv'
+            def to_base32(number):
+                is_neg: bool = number < 0
+                if is_neg:
+                    number = -number
+
+                digits = []
+                while number:
+                    digits.append(base32_digits[number & 31])
+                    number >>= 5
+                if not digits:
+                    return '0'
+
+                if is_neg:
+                    digits.append('-')
+                digits.reverse()
+                return ''.join(digits)
+
+            w.putln("{")
+            w.putln(f"PyObject **numbertab = {w.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(Naming.numbertab_cname)} + {constant_offset};")
+            c_string = '\\000'.join([to_base32(c[1]) for c in large_constants])

commit.message: Store numeric constants in packed arrays.
Refactor number conversion into separate steps, in and out.
Pack integer arrays according to their space needs.
Fix integer size boundaries.
Use per-bytelength arrays.
Use a tighter C-API function if we don't have large constants.
Declare "py_constants" per use case to tell the C compiler that it's really only of local interest.
Reverse condition.
Always use "__int64" in MSVC since it seems to be generally available according to https://github.com/mattn/gntp-send/blob/090b1276fb4a30601113551bed88c58329646818/include/msinttypes/stdint.h#L71-L90
Use existing "stdint.h" in Visual Studio 2010+.
Reduce size of counter variable in all reasonable cases.
Fix integer boundaries and test them.
Move number constants into a module state array for easier generic handling.
Always include "stdint.h", also on Windows.
Fix offset calculation.
Merge branch 'master' into packed_constants

tree 3a44f104ba822fed66367db3c61f30c9da731a04
parent 9da2811c7d3e71a70c1551fc88a221f87ad3eef2
parent 91b95ad076f326b284921d2bada8cd22f38aeb4e
author scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de> 1750671704 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1750671704 +0200

Merge branch 'master' into packed_constants

commit.message: Split long string literals of number constants.
Reduce C code overhead by typing inner function arguments.
Avoid closure usage.
Use bytearray for more efficient string building.
Minor C code simplification in the compiled Code.py.
Add 'L' and 'LL' suffixes to large C integer values in the constants arrays to prevent MSVC from misinterpreting them.
Fix funny formatting.
Fix comment.
Merge branch 'master' into packed_constants

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Store numeric constants in dense arrays
